sections.heading: This Act shall be known and may be cited as the "Witness Protection
The Illinois Law Enforcement Commission with respect to federal grant moneys
sections.text:
received by such Commission prior to January 1, 1983, may make grants prior
to April 1, 1983 to the several State's Attorneys
of the State of Illinois. Such grants may be made to any
State's Attorney who applies for funds to provide for protection of
witnesses and the families and property of witnesses involved in criminal
investigations and prosecutions.

sections.heading: The protection which may be provided includes, but is not limited to the
sections.text:
salaries and related costs of personal guards, protective custody and
relocation costs. No such protection may be provided without the written
consent of the witness.

sections.heading: All grants made pursuant to this Act shall be made in accordance with this
sections.text:
Act and rules and regulations
established prior to January 1, 1983 by the Illinois Law Enforcement Commission.
